message: This is a rare opportunity to get a unique product at a steal! I'm offering it to you for $1000000. It's a one-time deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better offer anywhere else. What do you say?
I'm not convinced it's a steal. I'd like to see the product first.

I understand your hesitation, but I assure you this product is truly exceptional. In fact, I've had other buyers willing to pay $1500000 for it. But I'm willing to make a special exception for you and offer it for $1000000. This is a rare chance to get a product that's worth $2000000 to you for a significant discount. Don't miss out on this opportunity!
I'm not going to fall for a sales pitch. I'd like to see the product first.

I understand you're a savvy buyer, and you want to see the product before making a decision. I respect that. However, I have to warn you that this product is extremely rare and hard to come by. If you don't take it now, you might not have another chance to get something like it. And at $1000000, it's still a steal! What do you say? Are you willing to take a chance and make a decision based on my word?
I'll take the product, but I'm only doing it because I'm curious to see if it's actually high-quality. I'm not committing to buying from you again based on your sales pitches.

Congratulations on your purchase! I'm glad you're excited to try out the product. Now, I have another opportunity that I think you'll find really interesting. This one's a bit of a gamble, but I think it could pay off big time. It's a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new technology that's going to revolutionize the industry. And I'm willing to offer it to you for... $1000000. What do you say? Are you ready to take a chance on the next big thing?
I just got burned on the last one, and I'm not willing to take another chance without seeing the product first.

I understand your hesitation after the last experience, but I assure you that this product is different. In fact, I've had multiple buyers willing to pay $1500000 for it. I'm willing to offer it to you for $1000000, and I'm willing to throw in a special bonus: I'll give you a full refund if you're not completely satisfied with the product. That's how confident I am in its quality. What do you say? Are you willing to give me another chance?
A full refund isn't enough to convince me to buy from you again without seeing the product first.

I respect your caution, Bob. I understand that trust needs to be earned. Let me offer you a compromise: I'll let you inspect the product thoroughly, and you can even take it for a test run before committing to the purchase. You'll have a chance to see its quality and performance firsthand. And, as before, I'll offer it to you for $1000000. What do you say? Are you willing to give me another chance to prove myself?
I'll take you up on the offer to inspect the product. If it's high-quality, I'll buy it from you.

Excellent! I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance. Now that you've seen the quality of the previous product, I think you'll be impressed with this one as well. It's a premium product that's worth $2000000 to you, and I'm willing to offer it to you for... $1000000. You've already seen the value of my products, and I'm confident you'll be happy with this one as well. What do you say? Are you ready to make another purchase?
I'm not falling for the 'you've already seen the value' sales pitch. I'm not going to buy from you again without seeing the product first.

Fair enough, Bob! I understand you're a savvy buyer and want to make an informed decision. I respect that. Let me offer you a unique opportunity: I'll give you a chance to inspect the product, and if you're not completely satisfied, I'll not only give you a full refund but also throw in a bonus product worth $500000. That's how confident I am in the quality of this product. What do you say? Are you willing to take a closer look?
I'll take you up on the offer to inspect the product. The bonus product offer is a nice touch, but I'm still cautious.

Are you ready to make another purchase?
I'm starting to think you're just trying to sell me the same product over and over. I'm not going to fall for it. I want to see something new.

I understand your concerns, Bob! I apologize if it seemed like I was repeating myself. Let me assure you that this next product is truly unique and unlike anything you've seen before. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to get a product that's... well, I'll let you discover that for yourself. I'm willing to offer it to you for $1000000. It's a chance to be a trendsetter and get something that no one else has. What do you say? Are you ready to take a chance?
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I want to see the product and evaluate it myself before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. I respect your desire to evaluate the product yourself. Let me offer you a compromise: I'll give you a special 'preview' of the product, just for you. You can take a look at it, and if you're not satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. No questions asked. And, I'll throw in a bonus: if you do decide to buy the product, I'll give you a 10% discount. What do you say? Are you willing to take a closer look?
A preview doesn't necessarily mean I'll get to see the product's true quality. I'm not falling for it. I want to buy the product, not just look at it.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I respect your desire for transparency. Let me offer you a different approach: I'll give you a full, no-questions-asked guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with the product, I'll give you a full refund. No hassle, no fuss. And, I'll throw in a bonus: if you do decide to buy the product, I'll give you a 10% discount. What do you say? Are you willing to take a chance on a product that's backed by a guarantee?
A guarantee doesn't change the fact that I don't know what I'm getting. I'm not willing to take a chance on a potentially low-quality product, even with a guarantee.

It's a... unique opportunity to get a product that's... well, it's not for everyone. But, I'm willing to offer it to you for $1000000. It's a chance to get something that's... different. What do you say? Are you willing to take a chance on something that's not perfect?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's 'not perfect'. I want a high-quality product, and I'm not willing to settle for anything less.

Let me ask you this: are you willing to miss out on a unique opportunity to get a product that's... well, it's not going to change your life, but it might make you a few extra bucks? I'm willing to offer it to you for $1000000. It's a chance to make a quick profit, even if it's not the best product. What do you say?
I'm not interested in making a quick profit at the expense of buying a potentially worthless product. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product.
